header.title: Step 1: Environment Setup
header.abstract: The first step in the tutorial is to setup the environment

section.title: Add runtime plugin to dependencies of plugin.xml
section.p: To enable the runtime layer the org.elver.store.hibernate.runtime plugin needs to be added to the plugin dependencies of the plugin.xml (see image below).
In addition the following Eclipse-RegisterBuddy: org.elver.store.hibernate.runtime, needs to be added to the MANIFEST.MF of the Library model project (see here why).
In addition your database JDBC driver should be added to classpath of the plugin and possible the packages of the jdbc driver have to be made visible to other plugins.

section.title: Create Empty Database
section.p: The runtime layer will automatically create tables and foreign constraints. However it will not automatically create a database. For this tutorial you need to manually create an empty database in your database server, the database should have the name: library.

section.title: Add Logging
section.p: To view the log messages of Hibernate and Elver you have to set the log4j properties. A simple sample log4j.properties file can be downloaded here. The log4j.properties file has to be placed directly in the src folder of the library model project.
Please click here to go to the next step to create a library object and store it.
